sense.name: a guiding principle
sense.examples: This emotional argument does not conform to the dictates of reason. The dictates of fashion go against wearing plaids with polka dots. A dictate of conscience is to be honest.

sense.name: an authoritative ruling, pronouncement
sense.commentary: DICTATE[+event][+speech_act][+ruling][+authoritative] Note: implies a pronouncement by an agent
sense.examples: The staff gradually learned to ignore the frequent dictates of the boss. The economic dictates of the new regime were contradictory and unenforceable.
